185875742.review:
Very sad to have found this game when I did (4.3 Hours of game play so far). This game is chock-full of player engagement with it's unique game play style. WASD movement, standard #s for skill Hotkeys, aim mouse pointer/click for standard attacks (non-target system), and No Auto features. I can see this game being amazing with it's PVP content considering it semi-bridges the gap between Action-MMORPG and a live-action fighter bringing very fast combat. Although under-populated and old: Aurcus Online has very similar combat and wanted to find a game with a similar game play style. This is like an advanced version of that game imo.
I am running the game on my Low-quality Dell Laptop and it plays relatively smooth. I see Dragon Sword is on the horizon and it looks gorgeous! However, I sadly do not own a PC or have the Money to afford one to be able to play it... This game satisfies this old craving for a game of this nature and hope that it sticks around so I can experience this game for a while.
I have been soloing since I have started and find that jumping to Level 99 as a new player leaves me lost (with a plethora of game/character building mechanics that was skipped and not "warmed" into having to do. Also, where to start that doesn't result in dying once out of the tutorial). Starting from Level 1 though has been easy... yet, a blast because of the game mechanics! Also, looks like fun if a friend wants to run quests with you in a party too.
Once again, although the beautiful Dragon Sword game is in development; I hope Eyedentity keeps this game around so I can have fun soloing/bringing friends along for the journey. I appreciate this awesome game A LOT!

P.S.- Please put Cooler wing options in the Cash shop for purchase. I do like the stat bonuses the wing/tail costumes provide. However, I am not looking to look like a feminine wolf Pegasus.

185084834.review: This game feels like something built to be a TAB target game but they slapped Action combat on it for novelty, the attacks have no weight, you cant interrupt attacks with a dodge and boss type enemies don't flinch at all leading to what feels like a ton of unavoidable damage.

184821609.review:
It could be (and apparently used to be) very very good. The combat feels fluid and I love the style of everything. The world felt nice but there is no one here anymore.

The only way to have fun now is to treat it as a single player adventure and enjoy the atmosphere. Even that is kind of difficult though, because at some point they completely destroyed the balance and you one hit everything. What I did to remedy this was find a good balance of removing gears and setting the dungeons on highest difficulty. 

I guess I will leave my review as positive because it's a free game that you can get some enjoyment out of with a little bit of work and balancing.
